description: From Latin secedere, from se- (“apart”) + cedere (“to go”).

verbs.description: secede (third-person singular simple present secedes, present participle seceding, simple past and past participle seceded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To split from or to withdraw from membership of a political union, an alliance or an organisation.
examples: We can secede from the United Kingdom any time we want.

entries.meaning: (transitive, uncommon) To split or to withdraw one or more constituent entities from membership of a political union, an alliance or an organisation.
